complete by standard interface

Source: R/complete_se.R
complete_se.Rd

Complete a data frame with missing combinations of data. Turns implicit missing values into explicit missing values.

complete_se(data, col_terms, fill = list(), env = parent.frame())

Arguments

data

A data frame or tbl.
col_terms

A character vector of column names or expressions to complete by.
fill

A list that for each variable supplies a single value to use instead of NA for missing combinations.
env

The environment as an argument (in case the function is called from another function).

Value

The data frame with implicit missing values identified.

Details

This is a standard evaluation interface for tidyr::complete(). The purpose of the function is to be able to use a vector of characters (column names) as the argument for expanding the data frame.

Examples

# data frame used to illustrate tidyr::complete()
library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(tidyr) # for nesting()
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘tidyr’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:wrapr’:
#> 
#>     unpack
df <- tibble(
group = c(1:2, 1),
item_id = c(1:2, 2),
item_name = c("a", "b", "b"),
value1 = 1:3,
value2 = 4:6)

# columns to complete by
col_terms <- c("group", "item_id", "item_name")
df %.>% complete_se(., col_terms)
#> # A tibble: 8 x 5
#>   group item_id item_name value1 value2
#>   <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>      <int>  <int>
#> 1     1       1 a              1      4
#> 2     1       1 b             NA     NA
#> 3     1       2 a             NA     NA
#> 4     1       2 b              3      6
#> 5     2       1 a             NA     NA
#> 6     2       1 b             NA     NA
#> 7     2       2 a             NA     NA
#> 8     2       2 b              2      5
df %.>% complete_se(., col_terms, fill = list(value1 = 0))
#> # A tibble: 8 x 5
#>   group item_id item_name value1 value2
#>   <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>  <int>
#> 1     1       1 a              1      4
#> 2     1       1 b              0     NA
#> 3     1       2 a              0     NA
#> 4     1       2 b              3      6
#> 5     2       1 a              0     NA
#> 6     2       1 b              0     NA
#> 7     2       2 a              0     NA
#> 8     2       2 b              2      5

# with nesting
col_terms <- c("group", "nesting(item_id, item_name)")
df %.>% complete_se(., col_terms)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 5
#>   group item_id item_name value1 value2
#>   <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>      <int>  <int>
#> 1     1       1 a              1      4
#> 2     1       2 b              3      6
#> 3     2       1 a             NA     NA
#> 4     2       2 b              2      5
df %.>% complete_se(., col_terms, fill = list(value1 = 0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 5
#>   group item_id item_name value1 value2
#>   <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>  <int>
#> 1     1       1 a              1      4
#> 2     1       2 b              3      6
#> 3     2       1 a              0     NA
#> 4     2       2 b              2      5
df %.>% complete_se(., col_terms, fill = list(value1 = 0, value2 = 0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 5
#>   group item_id item_name value1 value2
#>   <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1     1       1 a              1      4
#> 2     1       2 b              3      6
#> 3     2       1 a              0      0
#> 4     2       2 b              2      5
